trans-unit.source: You can handle the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser.ProgressChanged?displayProperty=fullName> event to implement a navigation progress bar for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowser> control similar to the one in Internet Explorer.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowserProgressChangedEventArgs.CurrentProgress%2A> property to determine the number of bytes that have been downloaded successfully.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowserProgressChangedEventArgs.MaximumProgress%2A> property to determine the number of bytes available for downloading.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowserProgressChangedEventArgs"></xref> class.
The number of bytes that are loaded already.
The total number of bytes to be loaded.
Gets the number of bytes that have been downloaded.
You can use this property to display the current navigation progress in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ProgressBar> control.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowserProgressChangedEventArgs.MaximumProgress%2A> property to determine the total number of bytes available for downloading.
The number of bytes that have been loaded or -1 to indicate that the download has completed.
Gets the total number of bytes in the document being loaded.
You can use this property to display the current navigation progress in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ProgressBar> control.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.WebBrowserProgressChangedEventArgs.CurrentProgress%2A> property to determine the number of bytes that have been downloaded successfully.
The total number of bytes to be loaded.
